definitions.text: the backward jerk of a gun when it is fired
a movement back from an impact
draw back, as with fear or pain
examples: she flinched when they showed the slaughtering of the calf

definitions.text: come back to the originator of an action with an undesired effect
examples: Your comments may backfire and cause you a lot of trouble

definitions.text: spring back; spring away from an impact
examples: These particles do not resile but they unite after they collide

definitions.text: spring back, as from a forceful thrust
examples: The gun kicked back into my shoulder
